Harmonized variables are consistently coded across census years. Source variables are the unrecoded variables unique to each sample, in string format. Source variables are only available for U.S. samples from 1940 to the present.

Variable groups:

Variable availability information:

Variables that are not available for the selected samples:

Source variable names:

Variable display order



Ordering of sample columns:

Display options
Help
An "X" indicates the variable is available in that dataset.

ADJGINC Tax unit's adjusted gross income P codes . . X X . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

Harmonized variables are consistently coded across census years. Source variables are the unrecoded variables unique to each sample, in string format. Source variables are only available for U.S. samples from 1940 to the present.

Variable groups:

Variable availability information:

Variables that are not available for the selected samples:

Source variable names:

Variable display order



Ordering of sample columns:

Display options
Help
Select samples and variables to build a data extract.

Supported by: National Institutes of Health, National Science Foundation, Ancestry, Stat/Transfer, and University of Minnesota.

Copyright © Minnesota Population Center, University of Minnesota.

Harmonized variables are consistently coded across census years. Source variables are the unrecoded variables unique to each sample, in string format. Source variables are only available for U.S. samples from 1940 to the present.

Variable groups:

Variable availability information:

Variables that are not available for the selected samples:

Source variable names:

Variable display order



Ordering of sample columns:

Display options
Help
Select samples and variables to build a data extract.

Copyright © Minnesota Population Center, University of Minnesota.

DEGFIELD2 Field of degree (2) P codes X X X X . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

Harmonized variables are consistently coded across census years. Source variables are the unrecoded variables unique to each sample, in string format. Source variables are only available for U.S. samples from 1940 to the present.

Variable groups:

Variable availability information:

Variables that are not available for the selected samples:

Source variable names:

Variable display order



Ordering of sample columns:

Display options
Help
Select samples and variables to build a data extract.

Supported by: National Institutes of Health, National Science Foundation, Ancestry, Stat/Transfer, and University of Minnesota.

Copyright © Minnesota Population Center, University of Minnesota.

    • X
    • Y
  • Search
Harmonized variables are consistently coded across census years. Source variables are the unrecoded variables unique to each sample, in string format. Source variables are only available for U.S. samples from 1940 to the present.

Variable groups:

Variable availability information:

Harmonized variables are consistently coded across census years. Source variables are the unrecoded variables unique to each sample, in string format. Source variables are only available for U.S. samples from 1940 to the present.

Variable groups:

Variable availability information:

Variables that are not available for the selected samples:

Source variable names:

Variable display order



Ordering of sample columns:

Display options
Help
Select samples and variables to build a data extract.

Supported by: National Institutes of Health, National Science Foundation, Ancestry, Stat/Transfer, and University of Minnesota.

Copyright © Minnesota Population Center, University of Minnesota.

Harmonized variables are consistently coded across census years. Source variables are the unrecoded variables unique to each sample, in string format. Source variables are only available for U.S. samples from 1940 to the present.

Variable groups:

IMPREL Imputed relationship to household head P codes . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . X X X X X X
INAME Second name, Indian schedules P codes . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . X . . . .
INCBUS Non-farm business income P codes . . . . . . X X X X . . . . . . . . . . .
INCBUS00 Business and farm income, 2000 P codes X X X X X X . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
INCBUSFM Business and farm income P codes . . . . . . . . . . X X . . . . . . . . .

INCFARM Farm income P codes . . . . . . X X X X . . . . . . . . . . .
INCINVST Interest, dividend, and rental income P codes X X X X X X X X . . . . . . . . . . . . .
INCNONWG Had non-wage/salary income over $50 P codes . . . . . . . . . . . . X . . . . . . . .

INCOTHER Other income P codes X X X X X X X X X X X X . . . . . . . . .

INCSS Social Security income P codes X X X X X X X X X X . . . . . . . . . . .
INCSTR Incorporated municipality, alphabetic string H codes . . . . . . . . . . . . X . . . Variable is not available in the selected sample, but is available in another sample in this year. Click on the variable name and view "availability".

    • F
    • G

  • Search
Harmonized variables are consistently coded across census years. Source variables are the unrecoded variables unique to each sample, in string format. Source variables are only available for U.S. samples from 1940 to the present.

Variable groups:

Variable availability information:

Harmonized variables are consistently coded across census years. Source variables are the unrecoded variables unique to each sample, in string format. Source variables are only available for U.S. samples from 1940 to the present.

Variable groups:

Variable availability information:

Variables that are not available for the selected samples:

Source variable names:

Variable display order



Ordering of sample columns:

Display options
Help
Select samples and variables to build a data extract.

Supported by: National Institutes of Health, National Science Foundation, Ancestry, Stat/Transfer, and University of Minnesota.

Copyright © Minnesota Population Center, University of Minnesota.

Harmonized variables are consistently coded across census years. Source variables are the unrecoded variables unique to each sample, in string format. Source variables are only available for U.S. samples from 1940 to the present.

Variable groups:

Variable availability information:

Variables that are not available for the selected samples:

Source variable names:

Variable display order



Ordering of sample columns:

Display options
Help
Select samples and variables to build a data extract.

Supported by: National Institutes of Health, National Science Foundation, Ancestry, Stat/Transfer, and University of Minnesota.

Copyright © Minnesota Population Center, University of Minnesota.

Harmonized variables are consistently coded across census years. Source variables are the unrecoded variables unique to each sample, in string format. Source variables are only available for U.S. samples from 1940 to the present.

Variable groups:

Variable availability information:

Variables that are not available for the selected samples:

Source variable names:

Variable display order



Ordering of sample columns:

Display options
Help
An "X" indicates the variable is available in that dataset.

Harmonized variables are consistently coded across census years. Source variables are the unrecoded variables unique to each sample, in string format. Source variables are only available for U.S. samples from 1940 to the present.

Variable groups:

An "X" indicates the variable is available in that dataset.

SLAVEOWN Number of slaves owned by owner P codes . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . Variable is not available in the selected sample, but is available in another sample in this year. Click on the variable name and view "availability".

Harmonized variables are consistently coded across census years. Source variables are the unrecoded variables unique to each sample, in string format. Source variables are only available for U.S. samples from 1940 to the present.

Variable groups:

Variable availability information:

Variables that are not available for the selected samples:

Source variable names:

Variable display order



Ordering of sample columns:

Display options
Help
An "X" indicates the variable is available in that dataset.

Harmonized variables are consistently coded across census years. Source variables are the unrecoded variables unique to each sample, in string format. Source variables are only available for U.S. samples from 1940 to the present.

Variable groups:

Variable availability information:

Variables that are not available for the selected samples:

Source variable names:

Variable display order



Ordering of sample columns:

Display options
Help
Select samples and variables to build a data extract.

Supported by: National Institutes of Health, National Science Foundation, Ancestry, Stat/Transfer, and University of Minnesota.

Copyright © Minnesota Population Center, University of Minnesota.

. . . . .
WKSUNEMP Weeks unemployed last year P codes . . . . . . . X . . . . . X . X . . . . .
WKSWORK1 Weeks worked last year P codes X X . . X X X X . . . X X . . . . . . . .
WKSWORK2 Weeks worked last year, intervalled P codes X X X X X X X X X X X X X . . . . . . . .
WORK5YR Working 5 years ago P codes . . . . . . . X X X . . . . . . . . . . .
WORKEDYR Worked last year P codes X X X X X X X X X X X . . . . . . . . . .
WRKLSTWK Worked last week P codes X X X X X Variable is not available in the selected sample, but is available in another sample in this year. Click on the variable name and view "availability".
X . . . Variable is not available in the selected sample, but is available in another sample in this year. Click on the variable name and view "availability".
. . . . . . . . . .
WRKRECAL Informed of work recall P codes X X X X X X . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

Harmonized variables are consistently coded across census years. Source variables are the unrecoded variables unique to each sample, in string format. Source variables are only available for U.S. samples from 1940 to the present.

Variable groups:

Variable availability information:

YRSPR2 Year of immigration to Puerto Rico (intervalled) P codes Variable is not available in the selected sample, but is available in another sample in this year. Click on the variable name and view "availability".

Harmonized variables are consistently coded across census years. Source variables are the unrecoded variables unique to each sample, in string format. Source variables are only available for U.S. samples from 1940 to the present.

Variable groups:

Variable availability information:

Variables that are not available for the selected samples:

Source variable names:

Variable display order



Ordering of sample columns:

Display options
Help
Select samples and variables to build a data extract.

Supported by: National Institutes of Health, National Science Foundation, Ancestry, Stat/Transfer, and University of Minnesota.

Copyright © Minnesota Population Center, University of Minnesota.
